entry.title: Time For A New Blog
entry.content:
Welcome everyone to the new and reimagined blog. I am trying a couple things differently now. First, I am using Hexo to generate my blog locally, rather than having Jekyll build it after committing to the repo. This has a couple benefits: first, Jekyll (or specifically Liquid) is annoying to deal with; second, I can test things easily without putting chnages into production, allowing me to avoid millions of embarrassing commits; third, I can probably make a better structured site like this.

For the time being, things will probably continue as normal. I will post on the current theme about anime, sports, school, physics, and other things while working on a new theme that I will write from scratch. This will be the challenge for this iteration of the site, as figuring out exactly what a Hexo theme needs to do, and also what it is capable of, will take some time. Fortunately, between testing, I can just switch themes and everything will work fine, so I won’t be motivated to neglect my writing with the rationalization that changing the aesthetic of the website should change the structure (which was true while I was working with Jekyll).

I have a couple ideas for the site in the future (in no particular order):
~

  • I will not bring back the guides or HLTB section (at least as they were) because it felt like they were mostly empty and I did not have enough to say on most things to make those worth it
  • I will work to do a good job of tagging most of the things I write, so that some form of categories can be used to get indexes of similar posts.
  • I will write a page detailing my current setups.
  • I will write a “future” post detailing short-term and long-term interests/goals that should serve as a reminder to me to get things done and also allow people who actually care to follow along.

That should cover basically everything an intro post should cover.
